titleStmt.title: The country farmer's vain-glory in a new song of harvest home: together with an answer to their undecent behaviour. Sung to a new tune much in request. Licensed according to order.
The country farmer's vain-glory in a new song of harvest home: together with an answer to their undecent behaviour. Sung to a new tune much in request. Licensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Dencon [sic], J. Balre and J. Back,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Our oats they are how'd, and our barley's reap'd".
Place of publication from Wing, which estimates 1688-1695 as publication date.

Sheet includes two songs; second part has title: An answer to Harvest home: or, A true character of such country-men who glory in cheating the vicar, & prefer bag-pudding & dumpling before religion & learning. To the tune of Harvest home.
Printed in two colums with woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the Glasgow University Library.
